alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 02 at 11:49AM PST until January 03 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM PST THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 10 to 19 inches above 4000 feet. Local accumulations of up to 24 inches over the highest peaks. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada above 4000 feet. * WHEN...From 7 PM PST this evening to 10 PM PST Wednesday. Heaviest from 9 PM PST this evening through 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with travel delays, chain controls, snow covered roads and reduced visibility at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This replaces the Winter Weather Advisory that was in effect previously. Snow levels around 5000 to 6000 feet this evening, lowering to around 3500 to 4000 feet overnight into Wednesday. Snow rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
